2. For each ITT stage, count the number of winners. This can be done by looking at the "winner" column for rows corresponding to ITT stages. Each ITT stage has only one winner, so there are 3 individual winners (rows 1, 20, and 23).

3. Compare the number of ITT stages with the number of ITT winners. If these numbers are equal, then the claim is true; otherwise, it is false. In this case, since there are 3 ITT stages and 3 ITT winners, the claim is true.
